review: Benadryl (diphenhydramine):So I've been taking this going on 2 years now, and I regret taking it so long, I even ended up in the ER because my heart wouldn't stop racing it was over 170.  I believe it was due to the Benadryl, I ignored the side effect before I noticed sometimes when I took it my heart would beat funny and it would be hard to catch my breathe but I kept taking it as it stopped my itchy throat, eyes, and mouth. Doctors at the ER found arrhythmia but said everything else looked fine. I stopped taking it, haven't take it in a week and I'm still having racing heart and palpations. Don't take this stuff long term. I'm in my early 20s and healthy if any one reading this was curious.
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):its making my heart race and making me feel soooooooooo weird and my sore throat didn't go away and I still feel bad
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):This medicine didn’t work for my husband like it claims it does
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Stops the itch by making you sleeply. After half hour I end up falling asleep and not having any itching needs.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Took benadryl for eight months on advice of PCP and Pulmonary specialist. I quit taking it because I began having short term memory problems. Checked it out on internet and found it should not be given to senior citizens. A neurologist at University Of North Carolina Memory Disorders unit said it should probably not be given to anyone as there are safer alternatives. I had  nervous breakdown and spent several days in a mental hospital. Had two MRIs of my brain. Second showed small area that was due to the Diaphenhydramine use. Alienated my family because of things I said . Without the Benadryl I wouldn't be the most heart-broken 74 yr. old lady around.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I took over the counter Benadryl for some minor reason and hours later I started itching all over my body.  The itch was deeply intense from my scalp to my feet - a full body reaction.  I started getting visible large hives and my throat and face was swelling.  I went to the ER and they said it was impossible that I was allergic to Benadryl. The ER doctor was certain I was having a reaction to the pink dye in the pill.  He injected me with clear liquid Benadryl to prove this to me.  I immediately had a second reaction. They had to treat me with alternative medications; an injection in my bottom, prednisone to help with breathing and another green pill of some sort to take home with me.  I am allergic to Benadryl.

Diphen (diphenhydramine):Cinnamon flavor alcohol base diphenhydramine is a med that truly helps with rapid onset allergic responses. It’s hard to obtain in US. Regular children’s Benadryl doesn’t deliver the quick relief of symptoms. Can you make it more available. Prescription is ok if that’s what it takes to get it during summer and fall months. Please

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I had been to the doctor for hives for insect bite and they told me to use Benadryl cream and medicine, but it didn't help. I used calamine lotion, and  everything else I could think of even cortisone 10 extra strength it didn't help. I went to the doctor for the 2nd time they told me to use the same thing, no help at all. I was itching so bad the hives were spreading even the itching and burning sensations to my arm, ankles,  burning feeling in my fingers and hives spreading to my chest. I couldn't help but scratch them sometimes that probably caused to help spread, but I couldn't help it. I went to see another doctor for the 3rd time and he prescribed Prednisone and Hydroxyzine and this is my 2nd day taking them and I see a great difference. My arms and everything clearing up and I finally could rest.. I recommend Prednisone. I give it a 10.

Benadryl Children's Allergy (diphenhydramine):My dog was sprayed with something poisonous from a frog in the bushes and if I had not had this in the house my dog would have died. Her airway was closing up and wishing minutes she could breathe again.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Received Benadryl via IV in prep for a biologic infusion. My throat starting swelling and my blood pressure skyrocketed. An immunologist tested me, and I showed strongly allergic to Benadryl, so it can happen.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Benadryl is the Gold Standard for allergies, anxiolysis, and sleeping aid. It works like a charm! It is not particularly fast acting, though. I usually take a half a tablet(12.5 mg) at a time and it can take up to an hour to really kick in.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):Benadryl works great to help with the chronic itching this infestation has caused - I got bit by chigger bugs. Only side effect is sleepiness so I spread the dosage of 2 out. It’s too bad the packaging is so difficult to open. My heart goes out to anyone with arthritis of trembling that would have to open  this product,

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):This is an old thread but thought I would share. I was in the hospital in labor. I developed a reaction to the epidural that caused severe itchiness. They gave me something that didn't help and after several hours of itching, a nurse gave me iv benedryl. I immediately couldn't breathe and felt like someone kicked me in the chest. I was warm all over, nauseous and on the edge of passing out. An ekg also showed I had a heart arrhythmia from it. I've taken oral benadryl in the past with no problems. Now it's on my list of allergies and I tell every doc I see. Most terrifying experience.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I suffer from severe sinusitis, but I am a person who suffers multiple other ailments. Especially, a really bad heart.(5 heart attacks and a mini stroke) this is the only over the counter med that helps me without effecting my heart in any way. I find it safe and has helped me when I had anaphylaxis along w prednisone.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I've used this and given it to my children for over 20 years.  My teenage son would take 1 before going to bed so he could sleep without allergic reactions.  I've used it for unknown allergies like bee stings and sunless tanner.  Works great and so does the topical cream.  No adverse affects with us.
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):If you have problems with Benadryl, try the dye free one.  I'm wildly allergic to FD&C Red #40 and must use dye free.  Dye free works well for me.

Alka-Seltzer Plus Allergy (diphenhydramine):I’m a 24 healthy female athlete I never get sick however I today have the flu when I take this med it helps the pain and aches but my eye swells completely shut 30 mins after taking this everytime - the left eye in particular lower lid and my eyes waters and gets pus

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I have no rest every time I take benadryl. I feel I have a really bad reaction as I feel restless, my body feels like itchy, nauseous and it makes me feel angry feeling restless it really hurts my stomach am I allergic to it? or it a bad reaction

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):Takes 4 hours to work and by then you need another dose. Since they took the other ingredient out, Benadryl and Wal-Dryl no longer work for me. Back to experimenting. No side affects, but not effective either.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I have had allergy all my life, pretty severe and I live in allergy heaven in TX. I have tried Everything and for me, benedryl is still the best.I work and it does not effect me, I often take it several times a day.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):My adult size teenage son was given Benadryl IV, 50mg, *along with Compazine IV as a "headache cocktail" in an emergency room in September of 2016. While there is no way to know for certain if Compazine or Benadryl caused the severe reaction he experienced, he has tolerated oral Benadryl just fine in the past. However,  it seems important to share our experience based on the severity of his reaction that day and that multiple reports of similar exist. I do not recommend the "headache cocktail" of Benadryl and Compazine together and hope the number of similar reports are looked into.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I take one before bed which keeps me breathing easily during the night despite my allergies.  It also helps me get to sleep and stay asleep.  The active ingredient, dyphenhydramine HCL, you will find is the main ingredient in quite a few over the counter sleep medications so that should tell us something.  And Benadryl or a generic drugstore brand are cheaper and just as effective.  Have been taking this for over 20 years and have no side effects

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Best drug for me to wake up with good sleep and not have a headache.  I have used it for 8 years for allergies (itchy eyes, bug reactions) and my house always has it in stock.  Love the drug!

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I couldn't stop coughing for one week, I lost my voice and severe lung pain due to the coughing. Went to see a pulmonologyst and did xrays, the results, negative. My lungs were clear and no infection whatsoever . He recommended me to go to Walmart and buy claritin pills, but I was desperate last night to have a good sleep without coughing all night, I haven't been able to sleep with this horrible killing coughing , not mentioning dry nose, itchy ears, and itchy throat. Last night I took two regular benadryl pills and slept like a babe for 10 hrs straight, the only problem is that I make my living driving and can't take the pills during the day. Probably I will take clartin during the day, but I honestly prefer benadryl, way more effective

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Allergy reaction to nuts. Started feeling swelling around mouth, throat.... very scary, feel like I am stopping to breath. This instant relieve. Give it 10-15 minutes till kicks in. WORKS WONDERS. BUT.... you might need a good snooze after a good dose...
Drowsiness is a reoccurring problem for me. I have difficulty focusing and end up passing out. The effect of the drug comes a little slowly depending on how severe my allergy attack is.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I have a severe dairy allergy and I have had it for all of my life. My doctor (who has been a doctor for more than 20 years) told me I had the worst case he has ever seen. If I touch it, I break out into hives, if I eat it or just put it in my mouth and then spit it back out, I go into anaphylactic shock. (where my lungs close up and I stop breathing) I always carry around the liquid Benadryl (because it works faster than the pills) in my purse. On many occasions, a double dose of it has saved my life and delayed the reaction from getting worse until I could get to the emergency room. Literally a life saver.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):Experienced an allergic reaction during dinner at a new restaurant. Throat started itching terribly so we left and drove to the nearest pharmacy. Used Benadryl syrup because I thought it would work faster. Fixed my allergic reaction in a minute.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I was given Benadryl at the hospital for an allergic reaction. It instantly shot my heart rate up to 217 bpm and instantly my mouth got dry I couldn't swallow my chest felt hot like an elephant was sitting on it and I got really cold. It put me into shock my body wouldn't stop shaking, I could breath.  It was so scary I thought I was dead thanks to the doctors quick response he saved me but it almost killed me.

My doctor gave me this in 2010 when I first began having seasonal allergies. I thought it was the best allergy medication out there, like top notch stuff. Turns out its just a basic type of medication. No superpowers involved, but it works great you would think there are superpowers in them!
Q-Dryl (diphenhydramine):Stopped the infernal itching (from poison ivy) within 15 minutes and dramatically reduced the spelling of the blisters.
It's a great medication except for the drowsy and sluggish effects.
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Relieves most allergy symptoms.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I use this medicine for weather allergies and allergies to medications when I need it. It does help greatly but does not last long and my burning sensation comes back into my body and the hives start to show. However a lot of people say that this medicine makes them feel sedated. I have the complete opposite I take 1 before bed and I will not sleep.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Works well and is one of my to go-to antihistamines. However it is very sedating and is also not long-lasting. It would work great for someone with insomnia as a milder sleep-aid, but for my use I would say that it works, but makes you sedated.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):I like this medicine, but unfortunately developed an allergy to it, yes contrary to ANYONE'S belief I AM allergic to Benadryl. My legs started to get really, really hot and felt like I just had to stretch them and run them under freezing cold water, then I woke up with hives all over.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I have taken Benadryl or its generic equivalent for many years.  It is very good for itchy throats and ears and all kinds of symptoms, and particularly good for sneezing. If the Benadryl doesn't work, then I know I'm coming down with something more than just seasonal allergies.  I try to keep Benadryl with me all the time.  There are so many food products that I am supposed to be allergic to that sometimes I take a Benadryl before I eat, especially peanut butter and bananas, two of my favorite foods.
Benadryl (diphenhydramine):Made me fall asleep. Makes me way too tired.

Benadryl (diphenhydramine):A little known and rare side effect of this drug is a condition that would probably be called idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP). This describes a serious depletion of platelets in the blood. The blood will not clot properly and an injury can be life threatening due to uncontrolled bleeding. It's rare but if it happens and the cause is not figured out by your physician(s) this is a big problem.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I have severe allergies and life has been miserable. I couldn't afford the time or money anymore for allergy shots. Claritan stopped working. So did a bunch of over the counter allergy medications. I took so many cough and zinc lozenges my tongue became sore. I coughed all the time, to the point of stomach pain and incontinence. My coworker just gave me a Benadryl. I was on the verge of going home sick, but now I'm 100% better. A stress rash that was erupting on the back of my neck just now went away. This is a marvelous product, and I didn't know it had so many uses.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I have been using Benadryl for the past 4 years and I never leave home without it. I have sneezing fits both indoors and outdoors and Benardryl is the only allergy pill that works for me.  It works fast and stops my runny nose immediately. Although I do feel sleepy (most of the time), I can't be without it.
Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I'm allergic to pollen. Took a dose, felt a million times better. Slept for 16 hours straight.

Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):I am severely allergic to all nuts and I always keep a few pills with me. If I eat something that has been in contact with nuts I take two pills or a gulp of the syrup and my itchy mouth and throat, swollen lips are instantly soothed. The syrup does work faster than the pills but pills are lighter to carry around. I once ate a huge piece of hazelnut chocolate and having benadryl on me really saved me. It won't work on severe reaction i.e. eating peanut butter but it is definitely a life saver for all other allergic reactions. I am never without benadryl and my epipen. Only thing to look out for is intense drowsiness, so make sure to be at home to take a long nap when it takes effect.
I use this medicine before going to bed when I have allergies and it helps me a lot.
Benadryl Allergy (diphenhydramine):It's the only one I trust with my allergies...
